user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_ip_count_unlock:
```c
static void
MHD_ip_count_unlock (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
  mhd_assert (NULL == daemon->master);
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_ (&daemon->per_ip_connection_mutex);
#else
  (void) daemon;
#endif
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
(void) daemon;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the '(void) daemon;' statement is inside the #else of a preprocessor conditional and is compiled only when neither MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS nor MHD_USE_W32_THREADS is defined. In that configuration it executes as a no-op to suppress an unused-parameter warning. When the macros are defined the line is removed by the preprocessor. In no case does this produce unreachable code in the compiled project.
